description:
High school student Katagiri Yuuichi, who values friendship above all else, enjoys a fulfilling life with his close friends Sawagiri Shiho, Mikasa Tenji, Shibe Makoto, and Kokorogi Yutori.

However, after a particular incident, they're dragged into a debt repayment game.

The only way to beat the "Tomodachi Game" is to not doubt their friends. Bound together by solid friendships, the game should've been easy, but– The hugely popular comic that sold over two million copies is finally becoming an anime! Will they trust or betray their precious friends? The true nature of humanity is exposed in the ultimate psychological game!

(Source: Crunchyroll)

Note: Premiered on Hulu and d Anime Store at 0:00 on Wednesdays, 1 hour 29 minutes ahead of Nippon TV's broadcast.
synonyms: โทโมดาจิ เกมมิตรภาพ
Tomodachi Game: Los juegos de la amistad

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Torture
tags.description: The act of deliberately inflicting severe pain or suffering upon another individual or oneself as a punishment or with a specific purpose.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Gambling
tags.description: Centers around the act of gambling.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Gangs
tags.description: Centers around gang organizations.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: CGI
tags.description: Prominently features scenes created with computer-generated imagery.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

node.description:
Previously worked as an assistant under [Tsuyoshi Yasuda](https://anilist.co/staff/98369/Tsuyoshi-Yasuda) on the manga serial [Over Drive](https://anilist.co/manga/32720/Over-Drive/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/sato_yuki0225)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡辺徹_(作曲家%29)

_Note: Not to be confused with the [voice actor](https://anilist.co/staff/215355/)._

__[Artist Profile (Avex Management)](https://avex-management.jp/artists/creator/CRHIB)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hibino_hirofumi)__

__Birthplace:__ Gifu Prefecture, Japan

__Hirofumi Hibino__ is a Japanese musician, arranger, composer, music producer and guitarist, who is active in the anime scene as an arranger and composer. His interested aligns with the piano, which he has had ever since his childhood. When he was 14 he picked up the guitar, when he turned 18 he was already a full-fledged artist, working as a freelancer.

__Height:__ 153 cm 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/NM_NANAPARTY) | [Website](https://www.mizukinana.jp/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/mizukinanaKING) | [Instagram](https://instagram.com/nanamizuki_nm7)

She is admired by many of her fellow actors and fans because of the fact that she has a great amount of power and strength in her singing voice, which surprises many fans due to her regularly petite stature. She was also the winner of the "Best Musical Performance" award in the first Seiyuu Awards. She was also part of the quartet Prits alongside Yumiko Kobayashi, Natsuko Kuwatani, and Hisayo Mochizuki (all four voiced characters in the anime _Sister Princess_). Her singing style comes from singing Enka since she was young.

In July 2020, she married someone from the music industry, and they had their first child on March 16, 2021.

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Ittasha in Bakuage Sentai Boonboomger

__[Website](https://saji.tokyo/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/saji_official) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/saji_staff/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/sajiofficial)__

__Formed:__ December 2010 in Sapporo College of Broadcasting Arts, Music and Dance, Sapporo City, Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan
__Genres:__ Rock, Anison

__Introduction:__
saji is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label King Records (2019–), having previously been under TOY'S FACTORY (2011–2016). They used to go under the name phatmans after school, before changing their name in July 2019.

__Members:__
- [Takumi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/162404/Takumi-Yoshida) (ヨシダタクミ) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Yoshimitsu Yamazaki](https://twitter.com/yoshimitsu_4gen) (ヤマザキヨシミツ) – bassist
- [Shinya Yuutani](https://twitter.com/flying_megane) (ユタニシンヤ) – guitarist

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pas_kun)__

__Date of Birth:__ March 6, ????
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Takumi Yoshida is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of rock band [saji](https://anilist.co/staff/141414) (previously known as phatmans after school). 

__Biography:__
He made a guest vocal appearance in the Kagerou Project with the song "Kuusou Forest", which was used as an insert song in the tenth episode of anime Mekakucity Actors. The lyrics, composition and arrangement of the song were all done by Jin, also known as Shizen no Teki P.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/pas_kun)__

__Date of Birth:__ March 6, ????
__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Takumi Yoshida is a Japanese vocalist, lyricist, composer and member of rock band [saji](https://anilist.co/staff/141414) (previously known as phatmans after school). 

__Biography:__
He made a guest vocal appearance in the Kagerou Project with the song "Kuusou Forest", which was used as an insert song in the tenth episode of anime Mekakucity Actors. The lyrics, composition and arrangement of the song were all done by Jin, also known as Shizen no Teki P.

__Genres:__ Rock, Anison

__Introduction:__
saji is a Japanese three-piece rock band under record label King Records (2019–), having previously been under TOY'S FACTORY (2011–2016). They used to go under the name phatmans after school, before changing their name in July 2019.

__Members:__
- [Takumi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/162404/Takumi-Yoshida) (ヨシダタクミ) – vocalist, guitarist and in-charge of lyrics and composition
- [Yoshimitsu Yamazaki](https://twitter.com/yoshimitsu_4gen) (ヤマザキヨシミツ) – bassist

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/三嶋章夫)

Affiliated with King Records.
Chief Content Officer (チーフ・コンテンツ・オフィサー) at [Crunchyroll](https://anilist.co/studio/6421).
